Feel free to tell me if this is not the right place to answer this question - My company wants to make a big announcement and as part of that, we want to insert a hyper-linked banner at the top of all of our pages, but we want it to be slightly different on the homepage. Is anyone able to tell me how complicated this would be? I am hoping to save our company from having to pay $400 to a contractor for this when it seems like an easy enough change, but no one in-house is familiar enough with HubSpot CSS to just do it.  Totally understand if the answer is - it depends on the design of our templates...

easiest way to do it, make a custom module, make it global, pop it onto every template of your site. have a boolean field determine if it’s showing.

Then use HubL to detect if the page is the homepage,  and have 2 RTE fields for the 2 different messages, display the appropriate one if it’s the homepage.
You will need a little bit of HubL, HTML, CSS and design manager experience to do it
if you know some hubl, you can do this :slightly_smiling_face:
(anyone who knows some hubl knows html and css) right?
not necessarily, a back end programmer could pick up on HubL quickly, but not know a lick of html or css
